intro: Ageratum laciniatum, commonly known as the fringed ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its flowers range from white to violet in color. Ageratum laciniatum thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It is also used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
